question: (a) With the aid of an annotated diagram only, illustrate the water cycle. (b) State three forms in which water exists in the soil (c) List five importance of water to crops.
answer:
(a) See the diagram of water cycle below

(b) Forms in which water exists in the soil are: (I) hygroscopic water(ii) capillary water. (iii) gravitational water.

(c) Importance of water to crops are:

(i) provides medium for absorption of mineral salts.

(ii) facilitates the transfer of nutrients to other parts of the plants where they are used in various metabolic processes.

(iii) water is an essential raw material in the process of photosynthesis.

(iv) used for hydrolizing food substances such as starch, proteins, fats and oils for easy transportation to other parts of the plant.

(v) water facilitates enzymatic activities occuring in crop plants.

(vi) it is a constituent of plant protoplasm.

(vii) the loss of water through transpi-ration is important for keeping the stomata open in gaseous exchange for respiration and photosynthesis.

(viii) it has a cooling effect on crops.

(ix) it helps to maintain plant turgor/turgidity.

question:
(a (i) State the law of supply in relation to agricultural production. (ii) Give an example of supply schedule and draw the supply curve for a named agricultural produce.

(b) State five causes of change in supply of an agricultural produce.
answer:
(a)(i) The law of supply in agriculture states that the higher the price, the greater the quantity of produce that will offered for sale and vice versa.

(ii) Example of a supply schedule for maize

Example of supply curve for maize

(b) Causes of change in supply of an agricultural produce are: (i) changes in price of commodity. (ii) changes in t cost of production (iii) changes in the technique of production. (iv) the effect of weather. (v) the effect of taxation ( shift in consumption by consumers. (vii) change in demand. (viii) change in distribution / marketing channels.
